metadata.title: CVE-2021-47474 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: comedi:vmk80xx: fix bulk-buffer overflow The driver is using endpoint-sizedbuffers but must not assume that the tx and rx buffers are of equal size ora malicious device could overflow the slab-allocated receive buffer whendoing bulk transfers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47474` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-azure - 4.15.0-1130.143~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.143~14.04.1').
